com.shop.cache.api.client.io
Class SCMultiManager

java.lang.Object
  com.shop.cache.api.client.io.SCMultiManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
SCManager, SCClientServerCommon, java.lang.Iterable<SCClientManager>
public class SCMultiManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements SCManager, java.lang.Iterable<SCClientManager>

Manages a farm of cache servers as an integrated set. Cached objects are sent to specific servers based on the hashCode of the object's key

Constructor Summary

Constructor Detail

SCMultiManager

public SCMultiManager(java.util.List<SCClientManager> clientSet)
Create the manager with the given set of clients. IMPORTANT: the list should be the same size and in the same order each time. Any changes will cause all objects in the cache to become missing.

Parameters:
clientSet - set of clients

SCMultiManager

public SCMultiManager(java.util.List<SCClientManager> clientSet,
                      SCHasher hasher)
Create the manager with the given set of clients. IMPORTANT: the list should be the same size and in the same order each time. Any changes will cause all objects in the cache to become missing.

Parameters:
clientSet - set of clients
hasher - hasher to use to map a key to a client index. Pass null for the default hasher

putWithBackup

public void putWithBackup(java.lang.String key,
                          SCDataSpec data,
                          SCGroupSpec groups)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
Same as put(String, SCDataSpec, SCGroupSpec) - however, the data is written to 2 managed servers for safety. i.e. if the main server fails, the data is still available on the backup.

Specified by:
putWithBackup in interface SCClientServerCommon
Parameters:
key - Key
data - data and TTL
groups - groups or null for no groups
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - errors
